complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down into: 1) Create time_blocks table migration with all specified fields, constraints, and JSON recurrence support; 2) Add composite indexes and overlap check constraints with test queries.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Standard Rails migration with composite indexes and check constraints for overlaps. Moderate complexity due to recurrence JSON handling and ensuring no PHI, but well-defined schema follows best practices for time-series indexing[1][4]. Testing straightforward with EXPLAIN.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Divide into: 1) POST create with recurrence parsing; 2) GET list with expansion logic; 3) PATCH update/cancel handling; 4) DELETE with conflict integration and 409 responses.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: High complexity from recurrence expansion (6 months ahead), conflict detection queries against appointments/blocks, service layer abstraction. Requires robust validation, edge cases like same-minute overlaps, and transaction safety[1][2].

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Split into: 1) API integration and calendar overlay rendering with colors; 2) Tooltips, drag-drop disable, responsive design; 3) Create/edit modals with form validation.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Frontend integration with scheduler library (React/Vue), real-time block visualization, mobile responsiveness, and API modals. Moderate-high due to UI state management and visual conflict feedback[4].

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down: 1) Worker setup (cron/triggered); 2) Open slots query (availability minus blocks); 3) Priority matching/scoring logic; 4) Hold creation, expiration, and audit logging.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Complex background job with SQL optimization for slot queries, weighted priority scoring, race condition handling for holds, configurable expiration. Sidekiq integration adds queue management[4].

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Divide into: 1) Notification delivery (SMS/Email templates, Twilio/SendGrid); 2) Confirmation handling (links/SMS reply); 3) Waitlist UI table with fill buttons and status transitions.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Integrates multiple channels with rate limiting, reply parsing, and UI state management. Moderate complexity but requires careful PHI redaction and audit trails[11].

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Split: 1) prior_auth_requests table migration with enums/JSON; 2) Abstract adapter + mock implementation with async state simulation.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Straightforward schema and pluggable pattern, but state machine testing and JSON history/attachments add moderate complexity. Follows adapter best practices[7].

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break into: 1) Rx form integration with PA modal; 2) Status polling/websockets and history UI; 3) Doc upload drag-drop and error handling.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: UI workflow integration with polling/websockets, file uploads, and state visualization. Moderate complexity for real-time updates and user flows[7].

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Divide: 1) faxes table migration; 2) FaxAdapter send/receive with mock file handling; 3) Inbound webhook endpoint and doc queue integration.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Involves file storage, webhook security, status tracking enums, and queue integration. Moderate-high due to async simulation and error states[8].

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Split: 1) Inbox/Outbox tabs with status lists and PDF viewer; 2) Send modal, retry logic, and download handling.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Standard tabbed UI with file handling and retry workflows. Lower complexity as backend adapter exists, focuses on UX polish[8].

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Backend session sync with expiry + Portal UI badges/buttons/notifications.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Polish/enhancement task with straightforward API/UI sync and expiry logic. Low dependencies make it simple[10].

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down: 1) HIPAA audit log table/service; 2) PHI redaction in Lograge/Sentry; 3) Sidekiq monitoring/retries/DLQ; 4) Rate limiting configuration.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Cross-cutting concern with HIPAA compliance, redaction patterns, queue monitoring, and multiple integrations. High complexity due to regulatory precision[11].

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: End-to-End Integration Tests and TaskMaster Generation
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Split: 1) E2E test scenarios for all features; 2) Task JSON validation and dependency cycle detection.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Comprehensive testing across features plus task management tooling. Moderate as it depends on completed work, standard Cucumber/RSpec patterns.
